alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Northern Erie; Southern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 3:30AM EST until January 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches with locally higher amounts possible in southern Erie County. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northern Erie, Southern Erie and Crawford counties. * WHEN...From 7 AM this morning to 7 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and reduced visibilities due to blowing snow. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute today and morning commute early Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will start this morning but will not reach maximum intensity until this evening, then continue overnight. Snow will quickly diminish Tuesday morning. The heaviest snow should occur across inland Erie County, generally southeast of Interstate 90 and east of Interstate 79. Higher snow amounts may continue into the northern portions of Crawford County.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
